hints.content:
We can think of subtraction as:

$\goldE{\text{ part}} = \maroonD{\text{total}} - \blueE{\text{part}} $

We can also think of subtraction as:

$\blueE{\text{part}} = \maroonD{\text{total}} - \goldE{\text{ part}}$

So, we can subtract $\goldE{26}$ from $\maroonD{85}$ to find the missing $\blueE{\text{part}}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/094612b1e1961e15f61332c9fa4733abed40abc4)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?**  
*Hint: Use the place value blocks to help solve.*

$26 = 85 - {}$ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]   

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/0f3be6e9835431d2748472e17fd07be95ad61807)
